channel.title: Sports
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Sports, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: NFL Week 11 Team of the Week: Josh Allen Headlines With 6-TD Performance
item.description: Here are the best of the best from NFL Week 11's Sunday slate.

item.title: Monday Morning NFL Top 10 Rankings: Eagles, Patriots Hold Firm; Rams, Broncos Climb
item.description: The Patriots and Broncos refuse to lose, threatening to upend Bucky Brooks' Top 10. But despite some drama, the Eagles are holding firm.

item.title: Super Bowl 2026 Odds: Rams Become Lone Favorite; Chiefs Slip After 5th Loss
item.description: Here are the latest Super Bowl odds, as the Rams keep on winning and Kansas City, surprisingly, keeps on losing.

item.title: Joel Klatt's College Football Rankings: Georgia Moves Up, Bama Moves (Way) Down
item.description: With the College Football Playoff looming, Joel Klatt's top 10 rankings are becoming a top 15. Here's where things stand after week 12.

item.title: NFL, CFB Weekend Betting Recap: Broncos' Win 'Saved Books From Losing Day'
item.description: The Chiefs' latest loss gave the books a boon on an otherwise uneventful NFL Sunday. Patrick Everson breaks down the NFL and CFB weekend betting actio...

item.title: Buzz: Who got the ball on Sunday?
item.description: Look beyond yards and touchdowns to determine who has the opportunity to score future fantasy points.

item.title: Seattle LB backs Darnold: If you rip QB, 'f--- you'

item.title: Pistons' Cunningham, Nike reach new 6-year deal
item.description: Pistons star Cade Cunningham has reached a new six-year endorsement agreement to re-sign with Nike and will receive his own signature shoe, his agents...

item.title: Sources: Penix has potential season-ending injury
item.description: Falcons quarterback Michael Penix Jr. suffered a potentially season-ending knee injury during Sunday's loss to the Carolina Panthers, sources told ESP...

item.title: Source: Concern Rodgers has break in left wrist
item.description: The initial concern is that Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers has "a slight break" in his left wrist, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.
